meanings.definition: To convey or transfer by will or lease.
meanings.sent1: She demised her family heirlooms to her grandchildren.
meanings.sent2: The landlord demised the apartment to the new tenants.
meanings.sent3: The cat demising its favorite toy to the dog caused quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The sun demising its warmth to the earth at dusk.
meanings.sent5: The magician demising his magical powers to his apprentice.

meanings.sent1: The old tree demised peacefully in the forest.
meanings.sent2: Many legends demised in battles fought long ago.
meanings.sent3: The idea of demising boredom on a vacation seemed absurd.
meanings.sent4: The hope of demising ignorance through education.
meanings.sent5: The candle demising slowly as the night went on.

meanings.definition: The act of transferring property by lease or will.
meanings.sent1: The demising of the estate caused a legal dispute.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the demising of assets is crucial in estate planning.
meanings.sent3: The demising of the keys to the kingdom was a grand ceremony.
meanings.sent4: The demising of responsibilities in a business partnership.
meanings.sent5: The demising of the crown to the new monarch was a historic event.
